text:
Python 3 support would be nice.  It would probably best be done by supporting both Python 2 and 3 in the same codebase, with some care.

It might involve bumping the minimum version to Python 2.6.

I have the start of a patch, hopefully will have a complete one soon.
title: Support Python 3

text: +1 on >=py2.6. I think this was the intention from the beginning.

Definitely >=py2.6. I was looking forward to checking out six for making oauthlib work with both py2+3.

On Friday, August 31, 2012 at 9:43 PM, David Gouldin wrote:

> +1 on >=py2.6. I think this was the intention from the beginning.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub (https://github.com/idan/oauthlib/issues/55#issuecomment-8201366).

So I accidentally opened another issue for this with the proposed branch.  I'll just close this one then in favor of https://github.com/idan/oauthlib/pull/56

Thanks!
